I beat DPH's extreme level in an hour, using this strategy:

I had my most powerful team (two clerics, a mage, an archmage) go to DPH's 
less-difficult level, which was basically the same thing only weaker. The 
mage stopped time long enough for the archmage to chain lightning the 
generators, at which point I allowed all but the archmage to die. The 
archmage summoned fifty fire elementals to destroy the remaining blobs. By 
doing all this and grabbing the life shields from the dead party members, 
the archmage leveled up to 136 instantly. From there, it was fairly easy to 
have the archmage beat the extreme level using hit-and-run tactics 
(teleport, chain lightning the bonepile, teleport, heartburst the mage 
tower, etc.) and then repeat the thing with the fire elementals.

I believe that it's more challenging and more entertaining to do larger 
missions, with a real plot, rather than just bust stuff up and leave. Maybe 
you'd like to try making a full level with a map and stuff, rather than just 
building on South of Talwood? It takes some experience to get fully 
comfortable with Scen and Editor, but it's worth it. Talk to you later.
                 -Tevildo, Prince of Cats.
